Class Modal

java.lang.Object
io.mindspice.simplypages.core.HtmlTag
io.mindspice.simplypages.components.display.Modal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component
public class Modal extends HtmlTag
Overlay modal component with backdrop. Features: - Semi-transparent backdrop overlay - Centered on desktop, full-screen on mobile - ESC key to close - Click backdrop to close (optional) - Z-index layering (backdrop: 1000, modal: 1001) Usage: 
Modal modal = Modal.create()
    .withTitle("Edit Module")
    .withBody(formComponent)
    .withFooter(buttonsComponent)
    .closeOnBackdrop(true);

    • create

    • withModalId

      public Modal withModalId(String modalId)
      Set the modal ID.

      The ID must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores. This is required for security as the ID is used in JavaScript.

      Parameters:
      modalId - The modal identifier
      Returns:
      this for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ID contains invalid characters

    • render

      public String render()
      Description copied from interface: Component
      Renders this component to an HTML string with an empty context.

      This is a convenience method that delegates to Component.render(RenderContext) with RenderContext.empty().

      Returns:
      HTML string representation of this component
